history.content: Stat 134 should help a lot with the probability section of CS 70. If you wanna go all out to prepare, maybe also take math 55 to develop some maturity to handle the discrete math section of CS 70 (although this is overkill).

children.subject: So should I swap 134 for CS70 and just take 70 with the breadth, and EE16B, ignoring 53?
I think that's a good idea! Good luck. You got this. Maybe try studying over December break too!
oh and do CSM!! That helped me
Thanks for the advice! But I’m scared that I won’t meet the gpa cutoff(I need an A-) and may need to use my emergency drop, which would make me below the minimum units. Any  thought on that?
You’re allowed to be below minimum number of units after emergency dropping!
Right... so I would need to fit in another class I see and take csm for a credit.

I'd recommend doing CS 70 over semester because you have a longer time frame to do it. Summer is very rushed. If you need a certain grade, doing it so rushed may leave you overwhelmed. Take CS 70 with a relatively course courseload, attend office hours, do problem sets with a good study group, who is as determined as you...
Do you think EE16A and B would be a good enough prep? I know the classes were designed to be a “trilogogy”like the 61 series. But do u think that’s equivalent preparation to math 110/113?

Hard for me to say. I haven't taken either EE16A or EE16B. I do know that in cs70 there are a lot of proofs, and EE16A does a little bit of proofs but math 110/113 all you do is mathematical proofs. I would be surprised if the lower divs which are focused on applied linear algebra/circuits will be as good a prep as math classes focused on abstract proofs.

If I dont have the space to take math 110/113 because I haven’t taken math 53, what do you think of my original combo of EE16B, stat 134, and math 53 along with a breadth(IAS150)? That’ll be 3 maths in a semester each with a decent problem set, all to prepare to slay the beast of 70

I think that would be good!! I would also recommend the 2 unit pre 70 decal! As well as the book How to Prove It by Daniel Velleman (you can find it online)! I don't think Math 53 will help you much for cs70. Still a good class to take tho!

Thanks a lot for the perspective! The Math 53 is actually for later upper div classes so I thought it’d be the perfect time to take it. I also heard of How to Prove it and have been reading it very slowly though... I applied for the decal for this semester but didn’t get it so hopefully next semester I can get a spot. Thanks again!
You are very welcome! Best of luck in your classes/CS70. The more work you do before hand the easier it will be!

I too was nervous about cs70 and so I took both Stat 140 (to get a lot of practice with probabiltt) and Math 113 (to get a lot of practice writing proofs). This helped me soooo much and I highly recommend it. Math 113 only has prerequisites of Math 53/54 and Stat 140 has Data 8 as hard prereq as well as linear algebra coreq. Maybe more. So maybe math 110/Stat 134 or Math 113/Stat 134 for you.

I'll just add another opinion on here. I took CS70 last summer, and as a transfer student, I didn't have time to take any courses to prepare (and the DeCal wasn't available back then). Therefore, during the entire month between spring finals and the start of summer session, I studied CS70. What better way to prepare for the class, then to take the class? I went through all of the notes. Then I went through them again. I did discussion worksheets, CSM worksheets, and even took a few practice midterms. I also read parts of "How to Prove It," which was recommended above. Fortunately, the preparation helped me get the grade I needed to declare! You can do it OP. Just be disciplined, and give it your all, and you will get that A-.

what would a "drop the class" score for MT1 be?  I'm in need of a B+, maybe a B, for CS70 next semester, depending on how things goes in a couple of days.  I've only taken EE16A here as far as math goes, taking 16B next semester along with CS70.  Math 1A and 1B I tested out of, so I am quite worried I might not have enough math background.
imo, i would take cs70 next sem, get a bad score on the first MT, realize how hard it is, drop, and use that realization to be scared to study hard and do better the next time around

history.content:
Hi all,

I need a certain grade in CS 70 in order to declare and the pressure is really starting to kick in because I'm a sophomore now. I've decided to take CS 70 summer 2019. In order to prepare, should I take CS 70 next semester(doing so means I may be able to use the emergency drop if I don't have the needed grade to declare)? Or should I take Stat 134(I've heard taking Stat 134 before CS 70 makes 70 much easier)? I've already taken Math 1A/B and EE 16A. Next semester, I have aligned EE16B, a breadth, possibly Math 53, and Stat 134(or CS 70, depending on the answers here). I'd really appreciate anyone's thoughts so please help me out ;) Thanks!
history.subject: Stat 134 before CS 70
